jobPostingInfo.title: University Recruiting Manager
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The University Recruiting Manager will lead our University Recruiting Team at JPL who are responsible for full life cycle hiring of intern and entry level pioneers in robotic space exploration—and through their discoveries, JPL is fundamentally shifting our understanding of the solar system and the universe. This position will report to Talent Acquisition Manager.

The Talent Acquisition team at JPL are experts that drive and influence the Lab’s recruitment strategy. We provide extraordinary client consultation and candidate experience to hire outstanding, diverse talent to meet the current and future needs of the Lab. In this role, you will lead a team of University Recruiters who will provide subject matter expert consultation with our hiring teams, HR business partners, the talent acquisition team, and our candidates, to attract and acquire the world’s most exceptional talent.

We are looking for an individual that is proactive, responsive, resilient, and engaged to bring in the best talent to the organization, understands how to develop strong relationships to achieve priorities and business goals, use data, analytics and metrics to advise decisions, identify concerns, and support action, as well as have a proven ability to lead, manage, and grow university recruitment team.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Lead the evolution of the University Recruitment team towards a function that is consistently viewed as a strategic, consultative, and proactive partner with the business, including ensuring strong partnerships within the HR organization and hiring teams

  • Collaborate with business leaders and Human Resource Business Partners to understand and meet each organization’s hiring needs

  • Build and sustain high levels of team engagement by setting clear standards of performance, monitoring and motivating them by providing constructive feedback and continuous coaching for their professional development and career growth

  • Provide leadership and guidance through strategic workforce planning and summer internship program events to encourage retention, intern conversion, inclusion and belonging

  • Partner with Internal Communications to drive talent branding initiatives and continue to position JPL as an employer of choice

  • Lead process improvement initiatives to meet the changing needs of the organization and to remove obstacles to ensure a strong talent pipeline

  • Challenge assumptions and recommend new and innovative ideas to continuously improve the hiring landscape within University Recruiting at JPL

  • Lead team to develop relationships with key stakeholders at select universities, organizations and selected vendors

  • Travel as necessary to conduct events, host students and organizations and conduct interview days, all while leading and directing the JPL representation

  • Contribute to our JPL employer brand through social media and experiences

  • Support and coach University Recruiters as needed during the hiring, offer negotiation and closing process in a very competitive, entry-level landscape

  • Ensure that University Recruiters are guiding our candidates through a delightful experience and ensures all candidate communication is timely and compliant

  • Manage the JPL Internship Program and create memorable experiences through events and key networking opportunities

  • Challenge assumptions and develop new and innovative ideas to continuously improve the hiring landscape at JPL

  • Stays on top of key market industry trends or university recruiting best practices in order to maintain a competitive presence (ex: NACE)

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors with 2 years lead experience

  • Experience managing and implementing major university recruitment projects and initiatives company-wide

  • Experience with full-cycle university recruiting 

  • Ability to manage a team to successfully think creatively and develop innovative and new solutions to attract difficult-to-find, passive talent

  • Proficiency with utilizing an applicant tracking system to manage an end-to-end hiring process with attention to detail and compliance. Workday preferred

  • Prior experience running a hiring process in compliance with EEO, AAP, and OFCCP guidelines strongly preferred

  • Ability to exercise independent judgement, discretion and confidentiality

  • Proven experience building teams and processes to scale in a growth stage organization

  • Experience with recruitment platforms and virtual environments: Applicant Tracking Systems, Candidate Relationship Management Systems, Event Technology, and Sourcing Platforms. Workday, Phenom, and Handshake preferred

  • Demonstrated ability to research, gather information, and recommend solutions to fit the strategic vision and organizational needs

  • Demonstrated ability to influence and bring resources together to implement solutions and enact change within the framework of ongoing activities.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written required. Communication is confident, professional, and polished

  • Awareness of key market industry trends and university recruiting best practices in order to maintain a competitive presence

  • Excellent time management skills, the ability to lead multiple projects at once and work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment with strong organizational skills, excellent execution and follow through

  • Ability to develop solid relationships and collaboration skills at all levels of the organization

Preferred competencies and experiences:

  • Experience within engineering and computer science disciplines strongly preferred

  • Knowledge of JPL or other FFRDCs

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$124,592 - $163,176

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
